about_the_game:
This is a strategy game based on the theme of Zhong Kui, closely following the classic story of Zhong Kui slaying ghosts, while incorporating a large number of original plots, presenting players with a familiar and novel world of ghost hunting.

Story theme

In the game, we delve into the ghost legends in traditional Chinese culture and reshape the righteous and powerful image of Zhong Kui in front of players. The game not only reproduces the folk customs of ancient China, but also cleverly incorporates a large number of folk stories and mythological elements, allowing players to enjoy the fun of the game while also feeling a strong cultural charm.

artistic style

Quoting traditional Chinese paintings from our ancestors as art materials in the game is not only a tribute and inheritance to traditional culture, but also a unique exploration of the game's art style. Although the author's painting skills are not high, hand drawn production itself reflects a love and persistence for art. If there are any shortcomings, we hope players can understand or provide corrections.

Strategic gameplay

As a strategy game, it emphasizes strategic layout and intelligent confrontation. Players need to cleverly match Zhong Kui's magic weapons and talismans according to the characteristics of different ghosts and monsters, and develop the most effective combat strategies. At the same time, the game also has a rich cultivation system, where players can continuously improve Zhong Kui's strength by collecting resources, upgrading equipment, unlocking new skills, and other methods to deal with even stronger enemies.

Story Experience

The game plot is full of ups and downs, closely following the classic story of Zhong Kui slaying ghosts, while incorporating a large number of original plots, presenting players with a familiar and novel world of ghost hunting. As the story progresses, players will gradually uncover the secrets hidden behind them and experience the journey of transformation from mortals to heavenly masters.
